<!-- Note: This template is a suggestion only. You may reorder, mix or split sections, omit sections or add new sections, change the style and anything else. Treat it as a good default for many tasks, but not a confident suggestion for all tasks. -->

## Summary
- very briefly, what is this PR about?

## Task(s)
- What task(s) does this PR address?

## Changes
- What high-level changes does this PR make?
  - What low-level changes correspond to these high-level changes? Use file paths, and optionally line numbers or symbol names.

## Testing and Quality Assurance
- What quality aspects were tested?
  - What concrete commands were run? Could they be run right now and deliver the same result? What interpretation did you make of the commands' output?
  - What files reviews were reviewed? By agent or project owner? What was the outcome of the review?
  - What new automations for the future were added to assure quality even after future changes? Unit tests, e2e tests, linter rules, new commands, etc.
  - What manual QA steps were taken? By agent or project owner? Are they useful to document for the future and if so where were they documented? What was the outcome of the manual QA?

## Risks / notes
- What uncertainties exist about the effects of merging this PR?
- What else should the project owner or agents be aware of when they look back at this PR in the future?

## Remaining work
- Anything that was in the original task description that was not done? Did the project owner agree yet? Did he instruct to create a follow-up task yet? Why was work abandoned or deferred to future work?
- Any follow ups that become clear only during the work on the task? What generating ideas did you have?
